texts.value: Beta-adrenergic receptors mediate the catecholamine-induced activation of adenylate cyclase through the action of G proteins. This receptor binds epinephrine and norepinephrine with approximately equal affinity. Mediates Ras activation through G(s)-alpha- and cAMP-mediated signaling (By similarity). Involved in the regulation of sleep/wake behaviors (By similarity)
Interacts (via C-terminus PDZ motif) with RAPGEF2; the interaction is direct (By similarity). Interacts with GOPC, MAGI3 and DLG4
Localized at the plasma membrane. Found in the Golgi upon GOPC overexpression (By similarity). Colocalizes with RAPGEF2 at the plasma membrane
Expressed in cortical neurons and coronary artery smooth muscle cells (at protein level)
The PDZ domain-binding motif mediates competitive interactions with GOPC, MAGI3 and DLG4 and plays a role in subcellular location of the receptor
Homologous desensitization of the receptor is mediated by its phosphorylation by beta-adrenergic receptor kinase
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family. Adrenergic receptor subfamily. ADRB1 sub-subfamily

citation.title: Molecular cloning and expression of the rat beta 1-adrenergic receptor gene.
Primary structure of the rat beta-1 adrenergic receptor gene.
Direct binding of the beta1 adrenergic receptor to the cyclic AMP-dependent guanine nucleotide exchange factor CNrasGEF leads to Ras activation.
Proteomic analysis of beta1-adrenergic receptor interactions with PDZ scaffold proteins.
Quantitative maps of protein phosphorylation sites across 14 different rat organs and tissues.

referencePositions: IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]
